snippet: More common in the Midwest, the Tom and Jerry is a drink that arrives at New York bars typically in the coldest weeks.
abstract: Tom and Jerry, relative of eggnog, has enjoyed small resurgence outside the Midwest as it has been rediscovered by mixologists eager to serve something traditional, yet different, during the holiday; recipe for Tom and Jerry offered.
lead_paragraph: More common in the Midwest, the Tom and Jerry is a drink that arrives at New York bars typically in the coldest weeks.

headline.seo: The Tom and Jerry, an Odd, Ephemeral Drink
headline.main: A Regional Oddball, Resurrected for Chilliest of Days
